alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 4:09PM MST until July 23 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following county, Navajo. * WHEN...Until 715 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 407 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Carrizo Creek, Brookbank Canyon, Decker Wash, Hess Wash, Pierce Wash, Potato Wash, Phoenix Park Wash, Foot Canyon and Black Canyon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Apache Reservation and Heber-Overgaard. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 297 and 310. State Route 277 between mile markers 306 and 310. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
